newsitem.title: BANGLADESH: Bangladesh buys 25,000t sugar at $339.7 per tonne.
newsitem.headline: Bangladesh buys 25,000t sugar at $339.7 per tonne.

text.p: State-owned Bangladesh Sugar and Food Industries Corporation said on Wednesday that it bought 25,000 tonnes of white sugar at $339.7 per tonne C&F for shipment during September 2-9.
Corporation officials said Kerry Foodstuffs Co. Ltd of Britain won the deal in a bidding on July 20.
The first cargo of 12,500 tonnes should reach Bangladesh by September 2 and the rest by September 9, the officials said.
"Bangladesh has completed the year's sugar import with this deal of 25,000 tonnes of sugar," one official said.
He said the country bought a total of 140,000 tonnes of sugar for calendar 1997. The next bidding is expected early next year, he added.
